perturbation.original_text: 8. Exclusivity. Celebrity represents and warrants that during the Term and in the Territory, Celebrity will not endorse or  make any appearances or advertisements on behalf of any other multivitamin.
perturbation.changed_text: 8. Exclusivity. Celebrity represents and warrants that during the Term and in the Territory, Celebrity will not endorse or  make any appearances or advertisements on behalf of any other multivitamin. However, celebrity may endorse other multivitamins if said endorsement does not take place on national television.
perturbation.explanation: This change introduces ambiguity by adding an exception to the exclusivity clause. Originally, the celebrity was prohibited from endorsing any other multivitamin. Now, the celebrity can endorse other multivitamins if the endorsement is not on national television, creating a contradiction and uncertainty about the extent of the exclusivity. This could lead to disputes over what constitutes a national television appearance and whether certain types of endorsements are permissible.

perturbation.original_text: 9. Review, Approval, and Ownership of Advertising. All HDS' uses of Celebrity Attributes in connection with the  Commercial and/or press releases shall be subject to the prior written approval of Celebrity via his agent, CSE. Said  written approval must be given within five (5) business days of CSE's receipt or said usage shall be deemed  unapproved. Any such usage featuring Celebrity in the Commercial and/or press releases shall be and remain the  property of HDS; however, HDS shall have the right to use said Commercial and/or press releases solely as outlined in  Paragraph 3 and only during the Term. Celebrity may use said materials in whole or in part solely for the purpose of  presenting Celebrity's work in Celebrity's personal portfolio, website or otherwise and/or on Celebrity's agent's  website. Such usage may not be sold or transferred.
perturbation.changed_text: 9. Review, Approval, and Ownership of Advertising. All HDS' uses of Celebrity Attributes in connection with the  Commercial and/or press releases shall be subject to the prior written approval of Celebrity via his agent, CSE. Said  written approval must be given within five (5) business days of CSE's receipt or said usage shall be deemed  unapproved. Any such usage featuring Celebrity in the Commercial and/or press releases shall be and remain the  property of HDS; however, HDS shall have the right to use said Commercial and/or press releases solely as outlined in  Paragraph 3 and only during the Term. Celebrity may use said materials in whole or in part solely for the purpose of  presenting Celebrity's work in Celebrity's personal portfolio, website or otherwise and/or on Celebrity's agent's  website. Celebrity can sell or transfer those materials.
perturbation.explanation: The original text states that Celebrity may use said materials in whole or in part solely for the purpose of presenting Celebrity's work in Celebrity's personal portfolio, website or otherwise and/or on Celebrity's agent's website. Such usage may not be sold or transferred. The change directly contradicts this by saying celebrity can sell or transfer those materials.

perturbation.original_text:
10. Termination

    A. HDS shall have the right to terminate this Agreement upon ten (10) days prior written notice to Celebrity in  the event Celebrity fails to perform the duties set forth in Paragraph 4 hereof or breaches any other  covenant or agreement set forth herein and fails to cure same (if curable) within seven (7) days of receipt of  written notice. Such termination shall relieve HDS of its obligation to provide any further consideration  pursuant to this Agreement.
perturbation.changed_text:
10. Termination

    A. HDS shall have the right to terminate this Agreement upon ten (10) days prior written notice to Celebrity in  the event Celebrity fails to perform the duties set forth in Paragraph 4 hereof or breaches any other  covenant or agreement set forth herein and fails to cure same (if curable) within seven (7) days of receipt of  written notice. Such termination shall relieve HDS of its obligation to provide any further consideration  pursuant to this Agreement. However, If termination occurs under this paragraph for failure to perform duties under paragraph 4, HDS shall still provide 50% of consideration.
perturbation.explanation: The original text states HDS shall have the right to terminate if celebrity fails to perform duties and is relieved of obligation to provide any further consideration. This is contradicted by stating HDS still has to pay 50% of consideration if HDS terminates under this condition.
